newsitem.title: BRAZIL: March start seen for Brazil privatization bonds.
newsitem.headline: March start seen for Brazil privatization bonds.

text.p: A system allowing Brazilians to trade their credits with an official workers fund for bonds usable in the country's privatization program should be up and running by March, Planning Minister Antonio Kandir said.
A bill drawn up Kandir would give workers the option of participating in the privatization process through privately managed mutual funds.
Workers would be allowed to transform up to 50 percent of their credits with the Time Served Guarantee Fund (FGTS) into privatization bonds to be deposited in the mutual funds, Kandir said.
The government intends to earmark for bonds about six billion reais it owes to the FGTS fund.

Kandir said the system would widen the base of investors taking part in Brazil's privatization program. A bill creating the new system would be sent soon to Congress where the government would seek its urgent approval, he said.
If in place by March, the mutual funds would enable investors to take part in next year's global offering of shares in mining giant Companhia Vale do Rio Doce.
